page.title: 18OLD LADY IN SHAWBURY
page.content: Our interviewee, born in 1907, has lived in this area for 48 years. She gets up about 6 a.m.She has tea and milk for breakfast but nothing to eat.Her main meal is at 4 p.m and she eats more vegetables than meat.She has tea at 9 p.m and goes to bed at about 10 p.m. In the morning,she goes to the shop to get her paper.Then she watches television.She enjoys gardening, knitting and crochet.She does all her housework herself and used to make her own bread but not since her children left.She goes to shop in Shrewsbury only when relatives can take her. When she was a child she was a bridesmaid and was very excited, but her father was called up to the First World War and he never saw her.She nearly cried as she told the story.
